intro: Psychridium oroboides, commonly known as the mountain psychridium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
